docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Schuler, the husband of the drunken driver who killed herself and seven others on the Taconic State Parkway on July 26, spoke for the first time since the crash, insisting that his wife, Diane, did not have a drinking problem and affirming the health of their marriage.

headline.main: Driver's Husband Denies She Had Drinking Problem

docs.abstract: Daniel Schuler insisted that his wife, Diane, did not have a drinking problem, and he affirmed the health of their marriage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Widely used rapid checks for the H1N1 virus — or any flu, for that matter — fail more than 50 percent of the time.

headline.seo: Quick Tests for Swine Flu Are Found  Wrong Often

docs.lead_paragraph: Property taxes in New Jersey are the highest in the nation by percent of a homeowner's income and by just about any other measure.

headline.main: An Appeal for a Better Real Estate Tax System

docs.abstract: After filing five tax appeals, I wonder, why can't we arrange our political affairs so that we're happy about our tax system?
docs.snippet: After filing five tax appeals, I wonder, why can't we arrange our political affairs so that we're happy about our tax system?

docs.lead_paragraph: The N.B.A. is bringing Kobe Bryant and Shaquille O'Neal together again for Christmas -- this time joined by LeBron James. Bryant and the defending champion Los Angeles Lakers will host James and the Cleveland Cavaliers on Dec. 25, one of the highlights of the 2009-10 schedule released Tuesday. It will be the fourth time in the five years since their partnership ended that Bryant and O'Neal -- traded to Cleveland in June -- will meet on Christmas. O'Neal and James will play their first game together in the league season opener, hosting the Boston Celtics on Oct. 27. The four-game slate that night concludes when the Lakers open their title defense against the No. 1 draft pick Blake Griffin and the Los Angeles Clippers. Orlando, the defending Eastern Conference champion, opens Oct. 28 against Philadelphia, then goes on the road two nights later to visit the Nets, giving Vince Carter a quick return to his former home.
